intro: Wislizenia costellata, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in moist, open habitats such as swamps and wetlands. Its leaves are pinnately compound with a distinctive veining pattern, and it produces small, greenish-white flowers. Wislizenia costellata is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
